-L_0_Wexv5S3yr94DOe1.summarized_text: Acetylcysteine has been used for cyclophosphamide induced haemorrhagic cystitis although mesna is generally preferred due to the ability of acetylcysteine to diminish the effectiveness of cyclophosphamide In the treatment of acetaminophen overdose acetylcysteine acts to maintain or replenish depleted glutathione reserves in the liver and enhance non toxic metabolism of acetaminophen Adverse effects for oral formulations of acetylcysteine have been reported to include nausea vomiting rash and fever Some reviews found that prior administration of acetylcysteine decreases radiocontrast induced kidney disease whereas another found questionable effects Several studies have found this anaphylaxis like reaction to occur more often in people given IV acetylcysteine despite serum levels of paracetamol not high enough to be considered toxic Intravenous and oral formulations of acetylcysteine are available for the treatment of paracetamol acetaminophen overdose Prior pharmacokinetic studies of acetylcysteine did not consider acetylation as a reason for the low bioavailability of acetylcysteine

-L_0_qn-c1rcJbvsjueM.summarized_text: Ambroxol is indicated as secretolytic therapy in bronchopulmonary diseases associated with abnormal mucus secretion and impaired mucus transport The main property of ambroxol for treating sore throat is the local anaesthetic effect described first in the late s but explained and confirmed in more recent work Ambroxol is a drug that breaks up phlegm used in the treatment of respiratory diseases associated with viscid or excessive mucus Ambroxol also provides pain relief in acute sore throat It was also recently shown that ambroxol triggers exocytosis of lysosomes by releasing calcium from acidic cellular calcium stores Ambroxol is also anti inflammatory reducing redness in a sore throat Surfactant acts as an anti glue factor by reducing the adhesion of mucus to the bronchial wall in improving its transport and in providing protection against infection and irritating agents

-L_0_xKl_w008jBhDCuS.summarized_text: If clinical presentation suggests the diagnosis of MERS CoV laboratory testing in accordance with WHO s case definition should be done and infection prevention and control measures implemented The MERS virus is transmitted primarily from animals to people but transmission from people to people is also possible MERS CoV does not pass easily between people unless there is close contact such as the provision of clinical care to an infected patient without strict hygiene measures It is not always possible to identify people infected with the MERS virus because early symptoms of the disease are non specific and are often mistaken for other respiratory diseases There have been clusters of cases in health care facilities where human to human transmission appears to be more efficient especially when infection prevention and control practices are inadequate Droplet precautions should be added to standard precautions when providing care to all patients with symptoms of acute respiratory infection Infection prevention and control measures are critical to prevent the possible spread of MERS CoV in health care facilities

-L_0a0LhaYIdOrxzIRWr.summarized_text: COPD makes it hard for you to breathe Tubes called airways carry air into and out of your lungs If they smoke and have COPD it tends to get worse faster These are the most common signs of COPD Your doctor will ask about your symptoms and medical history Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease COPD refers to two long term lung diseases chronic bronchitis and emphysema that often occur together This makes it hard to breathe At the end of the airways are many tiny air sacs People who lack a protein called alpha antitrypsin AAT may be more likely to develop it He ll also do a physical exam and conduct breathing tests The most common test is called spirometry If you have COPD these airways may become partly blocked from swelling or mucus

-L_0aDJTtoq-0cSNV-zQ.summarized_text: The first step is learning to breathe deeply Deep breathing also goes by the names of diaphragmatic breathing abdominal breathing belly breathing and paced respiration This interferes with deep breathing and gradually makes shallow chest breathing seem normal which increases tension and anxiety Shallow breathing limits the diaphragm s range of motion When you breathe deeply the air coming in through your nose fully fills your lungs and the lower belly rises For many of us deep breathing seems unnatural Breath focus helps with nearly all of them You may want to try several different relaxation techniques to see which one works best for you That can make you feel short of breath and anxious Deep abdominal breathing encourages full oxygen exchange that is the beneficial trade of incoming oxygen for outgoing carbon dioxide Then try a deep breath Breathe in slowly through your nose allowing your chest and lower belly to rise as you fill your lungs When appropriately invoked the stress response helps us rise to many challenges

-L_0aLXmxJOGr3psnI7S.summarized_text: Researchers at Trinity College Institute of Neuroscience and the Global Brain Health Institute found that focused breathing affects levels of noradrenaline a natural brain chemical messenger ShareBy Julie Hand It turns out the yoga masters were right breathing properly really can improve your attention span and help you focus better According to pranayama yoga there are three kinds of breathing Knowing that low breathing is best for you is step number one As you allow yourself to experience the fullness of your thoughts feelings and physical sensations during mindfulness meditation you use the breath as your navigational compass More youthful brains have a reduced risk of dementia and mindfulness meditation techniques actually strengthen brain networks A new study has found a direct neurophysiological link between the breath and the brain In this way the breath becomes your most basic tool to bring you into the present moment after your fleeting thoughts and feelings pass

-L_0aPmQ1tfh-P5Rqfzm.summarized_text: Aciclovir is used for the treatment of herpes simplex virus and varicella zoster virus infections including Its effectiveness in treating Epstein Barr virus EBV infections is less clear Aciclovir is converted by viral thymidine kinase to aciclovir monophosphate which is then converted by host cell kinases to aciclovir triphosphate ACV TP Interferon Synergistic effects when administered with aciclovir and caution should be taken when administering aciclovir to patients receiving IV interferon Aciclovir crystalline nephropathy is more common when aciclovir is given as a rapid infusion and in patients with dehydration and preexisting renal impairment Probenecid Reports of increased half life of aciclovir as well as decreased urinary excretion and renal clearance have been shown in studies where probenecid is given simultaneously with aciclovir Intravenous aciclovir may cause reversible nephrotoxicity in up to to of patients because of precipitation of aciclovir crystals in the kidney Classified as a Category B Drug the CDC and others have declared that during severe recurrent or first episodes of genital herpes aciclovir may be used

-L_0aS5ZZMNkwvPZg2EG.summarized_text: Posology Dosage in adults Treatment of herpes simplex infections mg Aciclovir should be taken five times daily at approximately four hourly intervals omitting the night time dose Any drugs administered concurrently that compete with this mechanism may increase aciclovir plasma concentrations Probenecid and cimetidine increase the AUC of aciclovir by this mechanism and reduce aciclovir renal clearance Prophylaxis of herpes simplex infections in immunocompromised patients mg Aciclovir should be taken four times daily at approximately six hourly intervals Suppression of herpes simplex infections in immunocompetent patients mg Aciclovir should be taken four times daily at approximately six hourly intervals However for patients with severe renal impairment creatinine clearance less than ml minute an adjustment of dosage to mg aciclovir twice daily at approximately twelve hourly intervals is recommended Treatment of varicella and herpes zoster infections mg Aciclovir should be taken five times daily at approximately four hourly intervals omitting the night time dose Dosage titration down to mg Aciclovir taken thrice daily at approximately eight hourly intervals or even twice daily at approximately twelve hourly intervals may prove effective

-L_0ajNAfoYLcWxCjkwo.summarized_text: Aciclovir is used for the treatment of herpes simplex virus and varicella zoster virus infections including Its effectiveness in treating Epstein Barr virus EBV infections is less clear Aciclovir is converted by viral thymidine kinase to aciclovir monophosphate which is then converted by host cell kinases to aciclovir triphosphate ACV TP Interferon Synergistic effects when administered with aciclovir and caution should be taken when administering aciclovir to patients receiving IV interferon Aciclovir crystalline nephropathy is more common when aciclovir is given as a rapid infusion and in patients with dehydration and preexisting renal impairment Probenecid Reports of increased half life of aciclovir as well as decreased urinary excretion and renal clearance have been shown in studies where probenecid is given simultaneously with aciclovir Intravenous aciclovir may cause reversible nephrotoxicity in up to to of patients because of precipitation of aciclovir crystals in the kidney Classified as a Category B Drug the CDC and others have declared that during severe recurrent or first episodes of genital herpes aciclovir may be used

-L_0al58jEPGbAvMUQlE.summarized_text: Posology Dosage in adults Treatment of herpes simplex infections mg Aciclovir should be taken five times daily at approximately four hourly intervals omitting the night time dose Any drugs administered concurrently that compete with this mechanism may increase aciclovir plasma concentrations Probenecid and cimetidine increase the AUC of aciclovir by this mechanism and reduce aciclovir renal clearance Prophylaxis of herpes simplex infections in immunocompromised patients mg Aciclovir should be taken four times daily at approximately six hourly intervals Suppression of herpes simplex infections in immunocompetent patients mg Aciclovir should be taken four times daily at approximately six hourly intervals However for patients with severe renal impairment creatinine clearance less than ml minute an adjustment of dosage to mg aciclovir twice daily at approximately twelve hourly intervals is recommended Treatment of varicella and herpes zoster infections mg Aciclovir should be taken five times daily at approximately four hourly intervals omitting the night time dose Dosage titration down to mg Aciclovir taken thrice daily at approximately eight hourly intervals or even twice daily at approximately twelve hourly intervals may prove effective
